page.title: 05Weather & Deer S Buriton
page.content: The average rainfall for the project area is 90-110 cm pa. The driest months are April, May & June. Summer max temperatures seldom exceed 30C & winter minimum is rarely below -15C. 1985 had below average sunshine & rain fall was not outside average.More snow than usual fell in Jan & Feb.Temperat- ures as low as -20C were recorded. THE DEER POPULATION Fallow & Roe deer are found in this area. Any woodland above 1 hectare normally contains at least 1 pair of Roe. The Fallow deer are rarely seen west of the area. They cannot cross the electrified London-Portsmouth rail line. An estimation of the annual cull based upon the Forestry Commissions own figures plus local estates & farms is 200 Roe, 60 Fallow. A special shed for hanging deer carcases was built at Dean Barn. It is EEC regulation size.
